comments:
Description:
"XML data source doesn't exist" pops up if a XML file's name begin with '#'

Build number: 
2.2.0.v20061128-0630

Steps to reproduce:
1, New a valid XML file make sure its name begin with '#'.such as #166445.xml.
2, New a XML data source on the file.
3, New a XML data set and click 'Next' button.

Expected result:
No error message occurs and able to do next operation.

Actual result:
The "XML data source cannot be retrieved.XML data source file is invalid or the file doesn't exist" message occurs.
Error log:
org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.OdaException: XML data source cannot be retrieved.XML data source file is invalid or the file doesn't exist.
	at org.eclipse.datatools.enablement.oda.xml.ui.wizards.XPathChoosePage.populateXMLTree(XPathChoosePage.java:365)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.enablement.oda.xml.ui.wizards.XPathChoosePage.createPageCustomControl(XPathChoosePage.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.design.ui.wizards.DataSetWizardPage.createControl(DataSetWizardPage.java:123)

When there is ?#? appearing in the xml file name, the url will truncate this name, causing an invalid file name. Before getting the url of this file, first get its uri, then get url from it, this problem will be solved
It works now, thanks a lot.

traces.message: XML data source cannot be retrieved.XML data source file is invalid or the file doesn't exist.
